alert.note: Alert for Ballard (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 04 at 12:28PM EST until March 14 at 11:18AM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky...Illinois... Ohio River at Olmsted Lock and Dam affecting Ballard and Pulaski Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO TUESDAY, MARCH 14... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River at Olmsted Lock and Dam. * WHEN...From late tonight to Tuesday, March 14. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CST Saturday the stage was 33.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 42.0 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday, March 14. - Flood stage is 36.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 42.4 feet on 04/04/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
